intro: Linaria diffusa, commonly known as the common toadflax, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features bright yellow flowers with four petals, arranged in clusters along the stem. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, often with a bluish-green hue. Linaria diffusa is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
